answerText: Pick's disease[10] Pick's disease is similar to this much better known neurodegenerative disease in which all six forms of tau protein form amyloid plaques that may be the cause of its symptom of memory loss.
heading: SUBMIT |2014 | WUSTL, Haverford, Bellarmine A | 21 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  [10] Name this disease in which only one or two of the six forms of tau protein build up in neurons to form plaques that are known as this disease's namesake bodies.
